text:
When rendering the areatree as xml, the baground trait was using the default 
Object.toString() which result in difference when comparing area trees.

The patch renderes the background trait as:
   background:color=#0000ff,repeat=0,horiz=0,vertical=0;

tested with:

fop.sh -xml test/xml/bugtests/padding.fo -xsl test/xsl/docl -at output
creator: bckfnn@worldonline.dk
bckfnn@worldonline.dk

text:
Sure, no problem here, but out of curiosity (Java 101 question):  why did you 
use a StringBuffer within your toString() implementation instead of just a 
normal String?

Never mind, I think because StringBuffer implementation is cleaner for multiple 
appends.  Anyway, patch applied--thanks!
creator: glenmazza@yahoo.com
gadams@apache.org
